MENAFN- UkrinForm In cooperation with the Territorial Defense Forces, the counterintelligence units of the Security Service of Ukraine SSU have destroyed nine Russian military vehicles over the past week. The relevant video was posted by the Security Service of Ukraine SSU on Telegram , an Ukrinform correspondent reports.

During the last air raid alert, the anti-aircraft defense systems activated over Uman District. The fragments of the destroyed missile dropped and damaged a civil infrastructure facility. Two persons were injured and taken to hospital, the report states.

related_infos.title: Aggressor Launches 11 Missile Strikes On Kramatorsk
related_infos.lines: Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information as is without warranty of any kind.  We do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy, content, images, videos, licenses, completeness, legality, or reliability of the information contained in this article.   If you have any complaints or copyright issues related to this article, kindly contact the provider above.   MENAFN- UkrinForm Russian troops launched 11 strikes on Kramatorsk, Donetsk region, this night, hitting a private residential sector. 'Kramatorsk survived 11 missile attacks this night. Russians struck a private sector. According to preliminary information, three residential buildings were damaged. Fortunately, nobody was killed or injured,' Pavlo Kyrylenko, Head of the Donetsk Regional Military Administration, posted on Facebook .

related_infos.title: Ukraine Army Destroys Four Enemy Missiles Fired From Black Sea
related_infos.lines: MENAFN- UkrinForm The Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine has shot down four Kalibr cruise missiles fired by Russian invaders from the Black Sea. The relevant statement was made by the Air Force Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Facebook , an Ukrinform correspondent reports.   One missile was destroyed by the air-defense missile unit of the South Operational Command over Odesa Region. Three more missiles were destroyed by the air-defense missile units of the Center Operational Command over central Ukraine.

related_infos.title: Three Civilians Killed In Donetsk Region Over Past Day
related_infos.lines: MENAFN- UkrinForm Russian troops killed three civilians and injured 13 more in Donetsk region over the past day, August 14. 'On August 14, the Russians killed three civilians of Donetsk region: in Bakhmut, Soledar, and Marinka. Thirteen more people were injured,' Pavlo Kyrylenko, Head of the Donetsk Regional Military Administration, posted on Telegram .   Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information as is without warranty of any kind. related_infos.title: Russians Kill Seven Civilians In Donetsk Region In Past Day
related_infos.lines: MENAFN- UkrinForm The Russian army killed seven civilians and injured 14 more in Donetsk region over the past day, August 11. 'On August 11, the Russians killed seven civilians of Donetsk region: three  in Bakhmut, two  in Kurakhove, one  in Marinka, and another one  in Avdiivka. Fourteen more people were injured,' Pavlo Kyrylenko, Head of the Donetsk Regional Military Administration, posted on Facebook . node_detail_info.title: Four Communities Come Under Enemy Fire In Sumy Region
node_detail_info.lines: At 06:15 p.m., the Russian military opened fire on the Znob-Novhorodske community, reportedly with self-propelled artillery. Eight explosions were recorded.   MENAFN- UkrinForm On August 20, 2022, the Russian military opened fire from the territory of Russia on four communities in Sumy Region, such as Buryn, Bilopillia, Khotin and Znob-Novhorodske. The relevant statement was made by Sumy Regional Military Administration Head Dmytro Zhyvytskyi on Telegram , an Ukrinform correspondent reports.

MENAFN- UkrinForm Since the full-scale invasion, Ukrainian law enforcers have registered 29,194 crimes of aggression and war crimes, committed by the Russian Federation, including 1,146 over the past week alone. The update was delivered by the Prosecutor General's Office , Ukrinform reports.

related_infos.title: Captured Azov Photographer Dmytro Kozatskyi Calls His Sister To Say Hes Alive
related_infos.lines: As reported, more than 2,500 Azov Regiment members were captured by the Russians after the order of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief to stop the defense of Mariupol and save the lives of the fighters.   MENAFN- UkrinForm Dmytro Kozatskyi, head of the Azov Regiment's press service who now stays in Russian captivity, has called his relatives to say he is alive. 'Dmytro Kozatskyi, call sign 'Orest', has been in Russian captivity since May. There was no news from him for several months but recently, already after the brutal terrorist attack in Olenivka, the defender managed to call his relatives. Dmytro said the most important thing: he's alive,' the Zhytomyr regional territorial center of recruitment and social support posted on Facebook .

related_infos.title: Russian Strike On Dnipropetrovsk Train Station Kills 15 Zelensky
related_infos.lines: Russia attacked neighbouring Ukraine on February 24 but after failing to make advances on the capital Kiev, Moscow pulled back to concentrate on taking the separatist-dominated areas in the east and the south of the country.   MENAFN- IANS Kiev, Aug 25 IANS Russian shelling of the Chaplyne train station in Ukraine's central Dnipropetrovsk region has killed at least 15 people and wounded some 50 others, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said.According to initial images from the site, which have not yet been verified, a passenger train was hit, dpa news agency reported.'Rescue workers are on the job. Unfortunately, the number of dead may still rise,' Zelensky said by video to the UN Security Council in New York. 'This is how we live every day. This is how Russia has been preparing for this UN Security Council meeting.'Train stations and rail infrastructure have been repeatedly hit during the war, which entered its sixth month on Wednesday. In April, at least 57 died in an attack on the Kramatorsk station.Russia attacked neighbouring Ukraine on February 24 but after failing to make advances on the capital Kiev, Moscow pulled back to concentrate on taking the separatist-dominated areas in the east and the south of the country.Still, the war is not leaving any part of the country untouched.Elsewhere in Dnipropetrovsk, an 11-year-old child was killed by Russian shelling on Wednesday, according to local officials.Ukrainian authorities earlier Wednesday reported attacks in several locations across the country, including the Khmelnytskyi region in the west and Shytomyr region in the north.--IANSintshsMENAFN24082022000231011071ID1104751547

node_detail_info.title: Russian War In Ukraine 363 Children Die Since Invasion
node_detail_info.lines: 'As of the morning of August 20, 2022, more than 1,081 children were affected in Ukraine as a result of the full-scale armed aggression of the Russian Federation. According to the official information of the juvenile prosecutors, 363 children were killed and more than 718 sustained injuries of various degrees of severity,' the message specifies.   Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information as is without warranty of any kind.  We do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy, content, images, videos, licenses, completeness, legality, or reliability of the information contained in this article.   If you have any complaints or copyright issues related to this article, kindly contact the provider above.

related_infos.title: Eight Victims Of Missile Attack On Residential Building In Kharkiv Yet To Be Identified
related_infos.lines: 'Three more bodies were found during a search operation on August 20. Among the dead is a labor teacher from a nearby school. He was 34 years old. The body of a 39-year-old woman from Lviv was also discovered under the rubble. One body found yesterday cannot be identified - it is only a very badly damaged torso. In total, eight bodies have not been identified,' Chubenko said.   MENAFN- UkrinForm Eight of the 18 victims of a Russian missile attack on a three-story residential building in the Saltivsky district of Kharkiv late on August 17 have yet to be identified. Dmytro Chubenko, spokesperson for the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office, told this to an Ukrinform correspondent.

related_infos.title: Four S300 Missiles Used To Destroy Russian Kalibrs Over Dnipropetrovsk Region Zaluzhnyi
related_infos.lines: Four Kalibr-type missiles were shot down near the city of Dnipro. We have used just four S-300 system missiles, Zaluzhnyi wrote. node_detail_info.title: Kingdom Holding Invests In Russian Energy Companies
node_detail_info.lines: Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding invested in Russian energy groups Gazprom, Rosneft and Lukoil between February 22 and March 22, it said on Twitter on Sunday.   Many Western nations have imposed sanctions on Russian energy firms and their executives following Russia's invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

node_detail_info.title: Russian Armed Aggression Affects Over 1097 Children In Ukraine
node_detail_info.lines: Over 1,097 children in Ukraine have been affected by the Russian armed aggression. According to the data from juvenile prosecutors, a total of 374 children were killed and over 723 received injuries of various severity levels, the report states.   MENAFN- UkrinForm A total of 374 children have been killed and over 723 injured in Ukraine since the Russian invasion started. The relevant statement was made by the Ukrainian Prosecutor General's Office on Telegram , an Ukrinform correspondent reports.

node_detail_info.title: Russia arrests two staffs in Ukraine
node_detail_info.lines: After taking control of the power station on March 4, Russian troops have arrested 26 violators of access control to the plant  the biggest nuclear power plant in Europe, the National Guard publicized. The facility carries on working with local staff, while Russian troops patrol the buildings and check for explosive devices and unexploded munitions, the National Guard said. node_detail_info.title: Crimea AttacksUkrainePuts Pressure On Lost Territory
node_detail_info.lines: There was no public claim of responsibility by Ukrainian authorities, but presidential aide Mykhailo Podolyak called it 'demilitarisation in action'  using the same terminology employed by Russia to justify its invasion of Ukraine.   Following a pro-Western revolution in Kyiv in 2014, Russian forces took over the peninsula, pushing out heavily outmanned Ukrainian soldiers.
